books.title: Brewster’s Millions
books.author: George Barr McCutcheon
books.summary: A young man stands to gain a fortune—but only if he loses one first.

books.title: The Square Emerald
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: Scotland Yard’s first female investigator sets out to prove the innocence of a convicted forger.

books.title: The Autobiography of John Stuart Mill
books.author: John Stuart Mill
books.summary: The autobiography of English philosopher John Stuart Mill.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: Five Children and It
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children encounter an ancient magical creature who grants them wishes—all of which go comically wrong.

books.title: Getting Married
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: On the morning of a young couple’s wedding, concerns about what is to come inspire discussions about the institution of marriage.

books.title: The Power of Darkness
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Two Russian peasants tragically succumb to selfish, immoral temptations.

books.title: The Magic City
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A young boy, upset by his older sister’s recent marriage, builds an imaginary city out of blocks and household items and then finds himself living inside it.

books.title: The Council of Justice
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: The Four Just Men match wits with the Red Hundred, an anarchist group bent on raising havoc in Britain.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.summary: An ancient undead monster terrorizes Victorian London.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.

books.title: A Study in Scarlet
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The self-declared world’s first consulting detective unravels a mysterious case of murder and revenge.

books.title: Confessions of an English Opium-Eater
books.author: Thomas De Quincey
books.summary: A portrait of the life of a drug addict in Georgian-era London.

books.title: Tusculan Disputations
books.author: Cicero
books.summary: Cicero gives practical guidance for living wisely and well by adopting a Stoic outlook and concentrating on the virtues.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Matthew Arnold
books.summary: A collection of occasional and dramatic poems by a Victorian poet, educator, and critic.

books.title: Democracy
books.author: Henry Adams
books.summary: A wealthy New York widow moves to Washington, DC, hoping to get “to the heart of the great American mystery of democracy and government.”

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Fritz Leiber
books.summary: A collection of Fritz Leiber short stories and novellas ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Wisdom of Father Brown
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: Amateur detective and Catholic priest Father Brown solves mysteries in this second collection of Father Brown short stories.

books.title: Practical Mysticism
books.author: Evelyn Underhill
books.summary: Evelyn Underhill makes the case that mysticism is accessible and beneficial to everyone.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.
